001package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
002
003import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D50;
004import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D65;
005
006import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
007
008import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
009import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
010
011/**
012 * <p>
013 * Implementation of a D65-based XYZ color space, as a substitute for Java's
014 * built-in standard connection space (obtained with
015 * {@code  ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_CIEXYZ)}), with improved
016 * accuracy. The reference white point of this color space is D50 and any XYZ
017 * coordinate passed to {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])} is assumed to be relative
018 * to D50 as well, thus no conversion (color adaptation) is necessary between
019 * XYZ values. See Sec. 14.1.1 of [1] for details.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
023 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/11/14
028 * @see XYZ50ColorSpace
029 */
030@SuppressWarnings("serial")
031public class XYZ65ColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
032        private static sRgbColorSpace srgbCS = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
033        
034        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
035        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
036
037        
038        private static final XYZ65ColorSpace instance = new XYZ65ColorSpace();
039        public static XYZ65ColorSpace getInstance() {
040                return instance;
041        }
042
043        private XYZ65ColorSpace() {
044                super(TYPE_XYZ, 3);
045        }
046
047        // ----------------------------------------------------
048
049        @Override       // convert this D65.based XYZ to sRGB 
050        public float[] toRGB(float[] thisXYZ65) {
051                float[] XYZ50 = this.toCIEXYZ(thisXYZ65);       // could be done directly!!
052                float[] srgb = srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ50);
053                return srgb;
054        }
055
056        @Override
057        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
058                float[] XYZ50 = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ(srgb);
059                return this.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ50);
060        }
061        
062        // -------------------------------------------------
063        
064        @Override       // convert this CS D65 XYZ to standard D50 XYZ
065        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] thisXYZ65) {
066                return catD65toD50.applyTo(thisXYZ65);
067        }
068        
069        @Override       // convert standard D50 XYZ to this CS D65 XYZ
070        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {
071                return catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
072        }
073        
074        // -------------------------------------------------
075
076        @Override
077        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
078                return xyz65;
079        }
080
081        @Override
082        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
083                return xyz65;
084        }
085
086}
